channel.title: Testing on Tommy's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Testing on Tommy's Blog

item.title: TS files may reference JS files complied
item.description: This is a case happening in unit testing. Any changes and console.log couldn’t be reflected in the testing log. It finally turned out that the testing was referencing a JS file complied as the route I imported didn’t have a suffix, and by default, the JS files will be consumed. In order to reduce the noises caused by JS files, you can run yarn clean
